medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient was referred to the rheumatology department after recent management of an anterior myocardial infarction (STEMI).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At age 13, the patient was admitted for fatigue, weight loss, and persistent headache, accompanied by no pulse in axillary, brachial, and radial arteries. There was a significant blood pressure difference of over 30 mmHg between upper limbs, with vascular bruits confirmed during auscultation of carotid, subclavian, and renal arteries. Symptoms progressed to the point of requiring an aortic bicarotid bypass due to severe vessel involvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with Takayasu arteritis at age 13 and underwent an aortic bicarotid bypass with Gore-Tex. Treatment included corticosteroids and cyclophosphamide, which were later stopped due to apparent disease remission.
